name: pnp-graph-connector-powershell-markdown
title: Ingest local markdown content using PowerShell
shortDescription: This samples contains a Microsoft Graph connector built in PowerShell that shows how to ingest local markdown files. For each file, it extracts the metadata from front matter, maps them to the external connection's schema and ingests the content retaining the content and metadata. The ingested content is set to be visible to everyone in the organization.
longDescription: This samples contains a Microsoft Graph connector built in PowerShell that shows how to ingest local markdown files. For each file, it extracts the metadata from front matter, maps them to the external connection's schema and ingests the content retaining the content and metadata. The ingested content is set to be visible to everyone in the organization.

thumbnails.alt: External content displayed in Microsoft Search search results, visualized using a custom Adaptive Card
Markdown content with front matter metadata that's ingested with the sample Microsoft Graph connector
